title: Rick Mallory
text:
Rick Mallory is a former <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="Guard%20%28gridiron%20football%29">guard</a> and college football coach.
Early years.
From <a href="Renton%2C%20Washington">Renton, Washington</a>, a suburb southeast of <a href="Seattle">Seattle</a>, Mallory played for the <a href="Washington%20Huskies%20football">Washington Huskies</a> from <a href="1980%20Washington%20Huskies%20football%20team">1980</a> through <a href="1983%20Washington%20Huskies%20football%20team">1983</a> under head coach <a href="Don%20James%20%28American%20football%29">Don James</a>. He was a <a href="tight%20end">tight end</a> his first two years, then moved to guard, where he was an All-<a href="Pac-12%20Conference">Pac-10</a> performer and team captain.
Professional.
Selected in the ninth round of the <a href="1984%20NFL%20Draft">1984 NFL Draft</a>, Mallory played five seasons with the <a href="Tampa%20Bay%20Buccaneers">Tampa Bay Buccaneers</a>, from <a href="1984%20Tampa%20Bay%20Buccaneers%20season">1984</a> through <a href="1988%20Tampa%20Bay%20Buccaneers%20season">1988</a>.
Coaching.
Mallory made his coaching debut at his alma mater, the University of Washington, as a graduate assistant in <a href="1992%20Washington%20Huskies%20football%20team">1992</a>. He became the tight ends coach in 1994 under head coach <a href="Jim%20Lambright">Jim Lambright</a>, and stayed through the <a href="1998%20Washington%20Huskies%20football%20team">1998</a> season. Mallory moved on to coaching the offensive line at <a href="Memphis%20Tigers%20football">Memphis</a> and <a href="UAB%20Blazers%20football">UAB</a>, then <a href="Middle%20Tennessee%20Blue%20Raiders%20football">Middle Tennessee</a> in <a href="2013%20Middle%20Tennessee%20Blue%20Raiders%20football%20team">2013</a>.
